select.title: (        ) up at the clock on the wall, the secretary found it was already midnight.

selectFill.title: a doctor was new in a town in scotland, and took over another doctor's patients. he <%0%> all the medical records of the doctor's patients and went to see them. one of the patients was a seventy-four-year-old woman, who had been bedridden(卧床不起) for forty years! after he <%1%> her, he was very surprised. the woman wasn't sick at all. the woman fell ill with a slight fever when she was thirty-four years old. her doctor said she had caught a cold and <%2%> her to go to bed and stay there until he saw her again. the woman recovered in a few days' time, but stayed in bed. she <%3%> the doctor, who was never to return at all. several weeks passed, the woman found out that she enjoyed life in bed. people <%4%> every sort of service for her. she refused to get up again. at first her mother took care of her. after her mother passed away, her brother-in-law <%5%> and nursed her. altogether the woman spent forty years lying in bed. the new doctor had never <%6%> a patient like this. he had no other choice but to refer to his teacher in a medical college in london, who was a specialist. the specialist felt it <%7%> strange when he heard the case. he drove to the town and examined the woman. he reported the case to the british medical journal. “by the time i examined the patient, it was <%8%> for her to stand on her own feet. she had not moved from her bed for forty years.” the specialist worked with the new doctor for several months. finally she <%9%> to get up. the patient lived for three happy, active years before she died at the age of seventy-seven in 1987.
selectFill.explanation: 苏格兰一个小镇上有个新来的医生，还接过另一位医生的病人。他浏览了医生病人的所有病历，然后去看了他们。其中一名患者是一名74岁的女人，她已经卧床不起40年了！在检查了她之后，他感到非常惊讶。这个女人根本没生病。该妇女在34岁时因发烧而生病。她的医生说她感冒了，并命令她上床睡觉并待在那里直到他再次见到她。该名女子在几天后康复，但仍躺在床上。她在等医生，他再也回不来了。几个星期过去了，那个女人发现她喜欢躺在床上生活。人们为她提供了各种服务。她拒绝再次起床。起初，她妈妈照顾她。母亲过世后，她的姐夫搬进来并照顾了她。该女子总共躺在床上花了四十年。新医生从来没有这样对待病人。他别无选择，只能去找伦敦一所医学院的专科老师。专家在听到此案时感到很奇怪。他开车去了城镇，并检查了那个女人。他将此事报告给英国医学杂志。 “到我检查病人时，她已经无法站起来了。她已经40年没有从床上移动过了。”该专家与新医生一起工作了几个月。最后她同意起床。病人生活了三个快乐，活跃的岁月，然后于1987年去世，享年77岁。

selectFill.title:
can you imagine what life would be like if there were no telephone? you could not call up your friends on the phone and talk to them. if fire <%0%> out in your house, you couldn't call the fire department. if somebody <%1%> sick, you could not call a doctor.
in our daily life we need to communicate with <%2%>. we do this mostly by speaking to other people and listening to what they have to say to us, and when we are <%3%> to them we can do this very easily. however , our voices will not travel very far even when we <%4%> ,and it is thanks to the <%5%> of the telephone that we are still able to communicate with each other and hold talks when we are far apart. we can hear each other as clearly as if we <%6%> in the same room.
the man who made this <%7%> was alexander graham bell, a scotsman, born in edinburgh in 1847. bell, a teacher of visible speech who later moved to canada, spent all his spare time experimenting. <%8%> enthusiastic was he in his research for a means for <%9%> speech by electricity that he left little time for his day-to-day work and at one time was almost penniless.
selectFill.explanation:
您能想象如果没有电话会怎样吗？您无法通过电话给朋友打电话，也不能和他们聊天。如果您家中发生火灾，您将无法致电消防部门。如果有人生病，您就不能去看医生。
在我们的日常生活中，我们需要互相交流。我们这样做主要是通过与其他人交谈，听他们对我们说的话，并且当我们与他们亲近时，我们可以很轻松地做到这一点。但是，即使我们大喊大叫，我们的声音也不会走得很远，这要归功于电话的发明，使我们仍然能够彼此通信，并且在我们相距遥远时还能进行交谈。我们可以像在同一个房间一样清晰地听到对方的声音。
实现这一目标的人是苏格兰人亚历山大·格雷厄姆·贝尔（Alexander Graham Bell），1847年生于爱丁堡。贝尔是一位有声言语的老师，后来移居加拿大，他把所有的业余时间都花在了实验上。他对用电发送语音的方式的研究非常热情，以至于他几乎没有时间从事日常工作，而一次几乎是一文不值。

selectFill.title:
mother's day is celebrated in the u.s. it's also a holiday in <%0%> other countries. it is on the second sunday in may. it is a day to <%1%> mothers. on that day mothers usually <%2%> flowers and cards. on the cards, children will write “thanks, mom”, “to the best mother in the world”, “best wishes <%3%> mother's day”, and so on.

where does the idea for the holiday <%4%> ? we should thank miss anna m. jarvir. she brought up the idea of having <%5%> day. she lived in west virginia. her mother died on may 9, 1905. she had a deep <%6%> for her mother. she wrote letters to some important persons. in her letter she asked them to <%7%> a day for all mothers. then mother's day was <%8%> on the second sunday in may by the u.s. in 1913.

on mother's day, children give presents to their mothers, <%9%> the whole family go out and try to do something nice for their mothers.
selectFill.explanation:
在美国庆祝母亲节 在其他一些国家也是假期。 现在是五月的第二个星期日。 这是感谢母亲的一天。 那天母亲通常会收到鲜花和卡片。 在卡片上，孩子们会写下“谢谢妈妈”，“致世界上最好的母亲”，“母亲节的最良好祝愿”等。

假期的想法从何而来？ 我们应该感谢安娜·米小姐。 Jarvir。 她提出了有这样一天的想法。 她住在西弗吉尼亚州。 她的母亲于1905年5月9日去世。她对母亲怀有深切的爱。 她写信给一些重要人物。 在她的信中，她要求他们为所有母亲寻找一天。 然后母亲节是由美国在5月的第二个星期日进行的。 在1913年。

在母亲节，孩子们会给母亲送礼物，或者全家外出，并尝试为母亲做些好事。

selectFill.title:
you really have to get very old before you realize you're old. i'm in my middle fifties and i don't feel old yet. however, sometimes i look back at my childhood and <%0%> things to the way life is for today's kids. some things have <%1%> changed.
one area of change is television. some changes have been improvements. some changes, <%2%> the other hand, have been setbacks.
when i started school, most people didn't have a television. tv was just beginning to get <%3%>. my father decided to go all out and buy a 16 inch black and white motorola set. i still remember <%4%> the lone ranger save people from the bad guys on that awesome electronic machine. that was exciting!
now, televisions have larger pictures in full color. the pictures are <%5%> and the sound is much more realistic. the new high definition sets are made to rival movie <%6%>. the variety and quantity of programming has increased greatly. there are hundreds of <%7%> and more shows than one person could ever watch. there are many fine entertainment and <%8%> shows. there's also a lot of garbage, stuff that most parents don't want their kids exposed to. overall, we have more choices, and that is good.
i wonder what television will be <%9%> when today's kids are my age.
selectFill.explanation:
在您意识到自己已经老了之前，您确实必须变老。我已经五十多岁了，还没老。但是，有时我回头看童年，将事物与当今孩子的生活方式进行比较。有些事情肯定已经改变。
变化的领域之一是电视。一些变化得到了改善。另一方面，有些变化是挫折。
我刚上学时，大多数人没有电视。电视才刚刚开始流行。我父亲决定全力以赴，购买16英寸的黑白摩托罗拉套件。我仍然记得看过那位独行侠在那台很棒的电子机器上将人们从坏人手中救了出来。太刺激了！
现在，电视上有更大的全彩图片。图片更清晰，声音更逼真。新的高清晰度电视机可以与竞争对手的电影屏幕竞争。编程的种类和数量大大增加。频道数不胜数，而且节目多于一个人观看的次数。有许多精美的娱乐节目和教育节目。还有很多垃圾，大多数父母不希望他们的孩子接触这些东西。总体而言，我们有更多选择，这很好。
我想知道当今天的孩子是我的年龄时电视会是什么样。

selectFill.title:
parents and teenagers often disagree about the amount of freedom and responsibility that young people are to have. the teenager often wants to be <%0%> choose his own friends, select his own courses in school, plan for his own vocational <%1%> , and earn and spend his own money and generally <%2%> his own life in a more independent fashion than many parents are able to <%3%> .

most problems between teenagers and their parents yield best to joint planning and decision making. within any particular family <%4%> are avoided and problems are solved when all of the persons take <%5%> inthe situation, <%6%> inworking it out. <%7%> parents and young people learn how to get <%8%> well with each other and develop skills in understanding and <%9%> understood, even the most difficult problems are relieved.
selectFill.explanation:
父母和青少年通常对年轻人要拥有的自由和责任感存有异议。 青少年常常想要自由选择自己的朋友，选择自己的学校课程，计划自己的职业前途，赚钱和消费自己的钱，并且通常以比许多父母所允许的更为独立的方式过自己的生活 。

青少年和父母之间的大多数问题最能促进共同的计划和决策。 当所有人都对这种情况产生兴趣，共同努力时，可以避免任何家庭内部的分歧，并解决了问题。 因此，父母和年轻人学习如何彼此相处，发展理解和被理解的技能，即使最困难的问题也能得到缓解。

selectFill.title:
sydney is australia's most exciting city. the history of australia begins here. in 1788 captain arthur philips <%0%> sydney with 11 ships and 1024 passengers from britain ( including 770 prisoners). <%1%> there are over 2.5 million people in sydney. it is the biggest city in australia, the busiest port in the south pacific, and one of the most beautiful cities in the <%2%> .
there are over 20 excellent beaches close to sydney, and its warm <%3%> climate and cool winter have made it a favorite city <%4%> immigrants from overseas. there are three things that make sydney <%5%> — its beautiful harbor, the sydney harbor bridge, which was built in 1932 and the sydney opera house, which was <%6%> in 1973.
but there are many more interesting things in sydney, beautiful shops and restaurants, for example, rows of interesting <%7%> houses that were built in the 19th century. summer or winter, day or night, this is an outdoor city. some british visitors think it is <%8%> american. some americans think it is very british. there is truth in both these opinions, <%9%> sydney takes both the old world — europe, and the new world——america, and makes it into something that is neither british nor american but truly
selectFill.explanation:
悉尼是澳大利亚最令人兴奋的城市。澳大利亚的历史从这里开始。 1788年，亚瑟·菲利普斯上尉带着11艘船抵达悉尼，有来自英国的1024名乘客（包括770名囚犯）。如今，悉尼有超过250万人。它是澳大利亚最大的城市，是南太平洋最繁忙的港口，也是世​​界上最美丽的城市之一。
悉尼附近有20多个绝佳的海滩，其温暖的雨季气候和凉爽的冬季使其成为海外移民的最爱城市。悉尼闻名遐famous的三件事是：美丽的港口，建于1932年的悉尼海港大桥和1973年开放的悉尼歌剧院。
但是在悉尼，美丽的商店和餐馆中还有很多有趣的事情，例如，成排的有趣的19世纪建造的老房子。夏天或冬天，白天或黑夜，这是一个室外城市。一些英国游客认为这就像美国人。一些美国人认为这是非常英国的。这两种观点都有道理，因为悉尼把旧世界（欧洲和新世界）都带到了美国，并且使它变成了既不是英国也不是美国的东西，而是真正的东西。

selectFill.title: the benefits of exercise  <%0%>  be stored for long. they should be renewed each day. astronauts who have spent long  <%1%>    of time in space know at first hand how weightlessness  <%2%>  to weaken man's muscles. on earth when our muscles lift, push or pull, they work  <%3%>  the resistance of gravity to maintain the good condition and build  <%4%> .   <%5%>  the removal in space of the resistance, they tend to <%6%>   strength and endurance. that is <%7%>   the legs of recently returned astronauts feel so trembling when they   <%8%>   take up the normal task of  <%9%>    the body's weight again.
selectFill.explanation: 运动的好处不能长期保存。 他们应该每天更新。 在太空中呆了很长时间的宇航员直接知道失重如何削弱人的肌肉。 在地球上，当我们的肌肉举起，推动或拉动时，它们会抵抗重力的阻力而保持良好的状态并增强力量。 随着空间电阻的去除，它们往往会失去强度和耐力。 这就是为什么刚返回的宇航员的腿在第一次承担起支撑体重的正常任务时感到如此颤抖的原因。

selectFill.title:
andy loved the idea. mary arthur <%0%> it. kurt mendez didn’t think it was any big deal. mr. el thought it was a brilliant idea. after all, it was <%1%> idea.
“it’s only fair, ” mr. el explained to his new fourth graders as they stood in line waiting for the lunch bell <%2%> ， “that we turn things around. every year you guys line up in alphabetical order(按字母顺序). alphabetical order to go to lunch, to go to gym, to go home, and so on. this year we’re using reverse（相反的） alphabetical order.”
mindy vale put her hand down as mr. el pointed <%3%> her. “i’ve always had to stand at the back of the line, ever since kindergarten! now i’m near the <%4%> . thank you, thank you!”
the teacher smiled. <%5%> ， he called on christopher cash, a serious and thoughtful young man. “mr. el, i think you should <%6%> this policy. this is very drastic and unnecessary. this could confuse our fragile young minds!”
“put a lid on it, chris!” shouted david tyler.
“we won’t have any outbursts like that, david! ” mr. el said firmly. he turned <%7%> christopher. “don’t <%8%> ， christopher. we only have strong minds in this class.”
“how many of you think this is a good idea?” mr. el asked. as you would probably <%9%> ， most of the hands that went up were in the latter half of the line.
selectFill.explanation:
安迪喜欢这个主意。玛丽·亚瑟讨厌它。库尔特·门德斯（kurt mendez）认为这没什么大不了的。先生。埃尔认为这是一个绝妙的主意。毕竟，这是他的主意。
“这很公平，”先生。当他们排队等候午餐铃声响起时，el向他的四年级新生解释说：“我们把事情扭转了。你们每年都按照字母顺序去吃午餐，去健身房，回家等等。今年，我们使用相反的字母顺序。”
敏迪·瓦莱（Mindy Vale）放下她的手。埃尔指着她。 “自幼儿园以来，我一直必须站在队伍的后方！现在我在最前面。谢谢谢谢！”
老师笑了。然后，他请克里斯托弗·卡什（Christopher Cash），一个认真又体贴的年轻人。 “先生。埃尔，我想你应该重新考虑这项政策。这是非常激烈且不必要的。这可能会使我们脆弱的年轻思想困惑！”
“盖上盖子，克里斯！”大卫·泰勒大喊。
“我们不会有那样的爆发，大卫！ “ 先生。埃尔坚定地说。他转向克里斯托弗。 “别担心，克里斯托弗。我们在这堂课上只有坚强的头脑。”
“你们中有多少人认为这是个好主意？”先生。埃尔问。正如您可能期望的那样，大多数举手在该行的后半部分。

translate.title: 礼貌是非常重要的。如果你懂礼貌，你总是与人为善，乐于助人。(if)
translate.answer: Good manners are very important. If you are polite, you are always kind and helpful to others.

translate.title: 我真想知道为什么那些取得很大进步的人总还对自己不满意。(wonder)
translate.answer: I wonder why those people who have made great progresses were never satisfied with themselves.

translate.title: 思想是通过语言表达的。（by means of）
translate.answer: Thoughts are expressed by means of words.

translate.title: 有什么能够取代一个母亲的爱和关怀呢？（replace）
translate.answer: Can anything replace a mother's love and care?

translate.title: 他将在他的讲话中概述他的几项新建议。（outline）
translate.answer: In his speech, he will outline his new proposals.

translate.title: 正是那些以前支持他的人，现在反对他了。(very)
translate.answer: The very people who used to support him are against him now.

translate.title: 我们很难把这个现象和任何我们知道的事联系起来。（phenomenon,relate...with）
translate.answer: We can't relate the phenomenon with anything we knew.

translate.title: 小姑娘的来信对她妈妈来说是个极大的安慰。( comfort)
translate.answer: The little girl's letter has been a great comfort to her mother.

translate.title: 在许多方面城市生活比不上乡村生活。（compare with）
translate.answer: Living in a town can't compare with living in the country in many respects.

translate.title: 锻炼有益于健康。（contribute to）
translate.answer: Exercise contributes to better health.

translate.title: 许多学生喜欢熬夜复习迎考。（stay up）
translate.answer: Many students like to stay up all night going over their lessons before examinations.

translate.title: 无论你去哪儿、无论你做什么，我都会在这里等你。（wherever, whatever）
translate.answer: Wherever you go, whatever you do, I'll be right here waiting for you.

translate.title: 显然，人们在休闲时间所做的一切，使他们能够满足他们的愿望。（enable…to）
translate.answer: Obviously, all things people do in leisure hours enable them to satisfy their wishes.

translate.title: 我发现他的理论是正确的。（find sth. + a）
translate.answer: I found his theory to be true.

translate.title: 环球旅游一直是他从孩提时代就开始的人生目标。（v-ing）
translate.answer: Travelling round the world is always his life goal from his childhood.

translate.title: 他不是适合做这个工作的人。（who）
translate.answer: He is not the person who is fit for the job.

translate.title: 这个计划本身就考虑得不周全，而且实施起来花费也大。（moreover）
translate.answer: The plan was not well thought out, moreover, it would have been too expensive.

translate.title: 随着工作时间越来越短和假期越来越长，如何度过休闲时间已经成为一个热门话题。（with）
translate.answer: With the working hours becoming shorter and shorter and holidays becoming longer and longer, how to spend the leisure time has become a hot topic.

translate.title: 建这个图书馆花了他们五年多时间。（take）
translate.answer: It took them over five years to build this library.

translate.title: 我们的喜好、品味、兴趣和个性与社会环境和学习经验有关。（be related to）
translate.answer: Our likes and dislikes, tastes, interests and characters are all related to social background and learning experiences.

translate.title: 这起交通事故在很大程度上是由于粗心大意引起的。（to a …extent）
translate.answer: To a great extent, the car accident was caused by carelessness.

translate.title: 他们并不是等着老师讲解，而是努力发现解决问题的办法。（instead of）
translate.answer: Instead of waiting for the teacher to explain, they try to find the solution to the problems for themselves.

translate.title: 你可以想象他是多么的悲伤。
translate.answer: You can imagine how sad he was!

translate.title: 听他讲大学生活是一件很有趣的事情。（it is + adj. + to do）
translate.answer: It’s was interesting to hear him talk about his life at University.

translate.title: 既然你是个大学生了，你应该学会不再依赖父母的帮助。（be independent of）
translate.answer: Now that you are a college student, you should learn to be independent of your parents’ help.

translate.title: 他将在他的讲话中概述他的几项新建议。（outline）
translate.answer: In his speech, he will outline his new proposals.

translate.title: 你认为你可以在六周内学好英语吗？（learn …well）
translate.answer: Do you think you can learn English well in six weeks?

translate.title: 这两家公司已就合同内容达成一致。( agree on)
translate.answer: The two companies have agreed on the contract.

translate.title: 他是一个不爱说话的（communicative）的人，与他交流可不容易。（communicate with）
translate.answer: He is not a communicative person, so it’s not easy to communicate with him.

translate.title: 对她而言，抓住这次学习的机会是很重要的。（it is important for…）
translate.answer: It is important for her to grasp this learning opportunity.

translate.title: 7、我们很难把这个现象和任何我们知道的事联系起来。（phenomenon,relate...with）
他睡觉前才记起要做家庭作业。（not...until）
translate.answer: He didn’t remember to do his homework until it’s time to go to bed.

translate.title: 对于他们来说，学会用这种语言思考比知道每一个单词的意思更重要。（it ismoreimportant for sb. to do sth.）
translate.answer: It’s more important for them to learn to think in the language than to know the meaning of every word.

translate.title: 一到北京我就给你打电话。（as soon as）
translate.answer: will call you as soon as i arrive in Beijing.

translate.title: 这些问题固然是些难题，但我相信是能够解决的。（indeed）
translate.answer: These problems are indeed a little bit difficult, but I believe they could be solved.

translate.title: 她又改变主意了，这让我们大家都很生气。（which）
translate.answer: She changed her mind again, which made us all angry.

translate.title: 据说那个人想要我赔偿他的损失。( it is said, pay for )
translate.answer: It’s said that the man wanted me to pay for his damage.

translate.title: 很遗憾我帮不了你。( regret )
translate.answer: I regret being unable to help ( regret that I can’t help)  you.

translate.title: 别着急，我相信你的梦想总有一天会实现。（come true）
translate.answer: Don’t worry. I’m sure your dream will come true some day.

translate.title: 他无论做什么，都非常仔细。（no matter what）
translate.answer: No matter what he does, he does it carefully.

translate.title: 为什么要学英语？不同的人会有不同的答案。
translate.answer: Why should we learn English? Different people may have different answers.

writing.title:
便条(message note),是指日常生活中,如果我们有什么事情要告诉另一方,或委托他人办什么事,在不面谈的情况下书写的一种条据，是一种简单的书信，内容简单，大多是临时性的询问、留言、通知、要求、请示等，往往只用一两句话。 
 
请根据下列内容，写一张便条： 
汤姆： 
你父亲来电话说他今天晚上8点将来看你，望你在家等候。 
                                            约翰 
                                           星期六下午4点30分
writing.answer:
4:30 p.m. saturday 
 
tom, 
 
your father called to say he would come to pay you a visit at 8:00 p.m. this evening and hope you would stay home waiting for him. 
 
john
